values:
the future freaks me out. that's about all i've got to say.
that's about all i've been thinking about.

i'm supposed to be thinking about the future right now, i guess. i mean, i'm a senior in high school. huge, monumental changes are coming. difficult decisions i don't want to make that i have to. right now.
i feel like i'm going to lose everything. i feel like i have to prepare myself to have nothing for the rest of my life.
i'm the type of person who expects the worst, more or less, on a regular basis. that way, you can either be right or you can be pleasantly suprised. and i'm expecting to go to a college where i have no friends. where i make no friends. where i find out i can't do what i want to do. where i find out i'm just not good enough. where i find out that i don't really want what i thought i wanted. when i find out that i really have nothing in the world.
i don't want to be alone.
i guess, it would all be alright, probably, if i knew i could keep my best friends. i honestly could get through anything if i could keep them.
but reality is harsh. and one friend is even harsher. i honestly don't even know what the one friend is really thinking about it all. the two are total opposites when it comes to the after high school thing. good/bad toss up.
but it's awful. it's all i can think about. i really just want to focus on having a fun senior year. but it's like college is always right there. i can't go a day without thinking about it or having to decide something for my future. i want to focus present. not spend all of this on what will be.
i'm really hoping that things will slow down with the future/decisionmaking stuff and all the obsessing in my head as time goes by. but not after too much time goes by. i don't want to look up one day and realize i missed my senior year getting ready for something part of me is dreading.

whothefuckknows, really.

went to post and this was saved as a draft. don't know why i never posted it. well, sort of. oh well. there it is.


how fucked up is it that the one person I care more about than anyone I've ever cared about doesn't want to be alive. and I don't care. I still care about them more than ever.

I can't take these fights anymore
I've got too much at stake
I swear I spent too many nights on the floor
I set myself up to blow it
I'm such an ass and I know it
This time I'm falling faster...

frozen food. 

Things like frozen chicken fingers, frozen dinners, frozen appetizers. Just hit up the frozen foods aisle and dump everything in the cart.
it's so damn hard to believe in the things that matter most

Sometimes I wanna cheat but I don't I wanna quit but I won't because I made this bet

You're only brave until scared you're only unique until compared

You can't afford to live like this
(yes we can, yes we can)
You can't be dumb enough to dream so big
(yes we can, yes we can)

I'm not done yet
You know I'm only getting started




Livin' Th' Dream by You, Me, and Everyone We Know

I need to get out of here. I can't wait to go to college and be... my own person. I don't know how much longer I can put up with my family. Yeah, family my ass. To me, family is just a technical term. My true "family" will be the friends I choose.

I'm thinking of getting a Blogger account... which I probably shouldn't say on here but oh well. I'll link when it happens.



these are feelings I hid
for so long

feelings 
because of 
you

I've been having trouble lately coming up with the right words to use. Mostly in English papers. Like I know what it is that I want to say, and a lot of the time the word is right there... but I can't think of it. And I love words like the ones I can't think of... that describe complex or specific things that you could explain in a paragraph in just one word. 
I am not particularly fond of school recently. I don't really like it and the homework load is intense. I took the ACT this past weekend, so that's over with now but the homework is still a lot. And I imagine that it's only going to get worse next year because I'll be taking... four? AP classes. AP Calc, AP Gov, AP Chem, AP Lit... plus imedia which is a sweet class that requires no work outside of the class but it takes up two periods. Well, I guess half of the time I use one of them for a study hall anyway, so that will help. Taking Spanish four this year was kind of a mistake. I could have tried to take contemp law, which I want to take next year. Because of the whole maybe wanting to be a forensic scientist thing. Which is scary because not only is this a sort of ambitious goal with the whole probably need a graduate degree or whatever, but I am also afraid to officially say this is what I want to do for sure. Because, well you never know. I could change my mind and then I'm back at square one. Well, more like square two because I actually have another idea as to a career. But in a way I'll feel like I failed if I change my mind. But then I hear that people change their majors even halfway through college all the time, which also freaks me out. Like I have to decide what I want to do with the rest of life NOW or I screw myself over. There have been so many times in my life where I've looked back and thought, wow, I was so ignorant and young back then. Imagine how I'll feel 5 years from now. Wow, what were you thinking? Now your entire life is screwed over because of it. And it's not even like it'd be my fault. I mean, I have make a decision before that point. When I probably am going to be slightly if not completely ignorant about how I'll be in the future. And maybe ignorant isn't the right word but I'm not going to even bother trying to come up with a better one because of what I just said at the beginning of all this.
Oh future, how you stress me out.

Today is Ash Wednesday. I ate snacks and chicken and dumpling soup. I did a very good job of not letting my mom know. Decision is made, I guess.

I don't have much time to do anything. I'm taking the ACT this Saturday and I have a TON of homework, so I don't know when I'm going to get in some final ACT studying other than Friday night. I'm stressing... hardcore.

 

this town is upside down
this town is topsy turvy
where the hell did I wake up?

I just figured out what the random song stuck in my head was based only on the beginning beat of it. I couldn't even put lyrics to it, let alone an artist. Just thought it was kind of cool, ha. The song, by the way, was Bridge and Tunnel Authority (remix?) by Less Than Jake. Mad skillzzz.

Lent starts this Wednesday. I am having an... internal conflict about ha. This year I think is the first year where I've really decided that Catholcism is not me. I don't want to be Catholic and I don't have Catholic beliefs. So, do I follow all of the Catholic "rules" for Lent? No meat on Fridays, "fasting" inbetween meals on Ash Wednesday and Good Friday? It probably wouldn't be too hard to just end up not eating meat on Fridays... my parents will make something fish for dinner. But I don't think I'm okay with just "ending up" not doing it. I feel like I have to make a decision one way or the other. See, it's times like this where I kind of wish I had a shrink haha. 








'cause all I am is standing still...

(actually my own randomness, not from a song)

I've been completely obsessively stressing about finding a college lately. Probably to an unhealthy extent. For the most part I know what I want in a college... I just can't find it.
And today my mother has been completely... ridiculous. I don't even know where this comes from most of the time but today has just been exceptionally bad. I found this college, University of New Haven, that actually the closest I've gotten to what I want and I told her about it when she got home and she basically flipped a bitch on me about how I'm "never coming back." Which I totally don't understand because HELLO BITCH I'm sharing shit about what I want in my life with you. What the fuck is it now? You've been annoying me to share what I want to do with my life and what I want in a college and this past week or so I have been and then THIS. I'm not going to stay within their "desired 2-3 hour radius" if I can find what I want elsewhere. No way. I'd be fucking crazy. And flipouts like this only serve to make me never want to "come back." 

Anyway, I have an English paper to write.


I'm sick and tired of writing songs about you
this is it this is the end.

I will always remember making out til the sun went down
counting stars on the hood of a car
catching my friends as they were falling down

we swore it wouldn't be the last time



-Days of the Old by Every Avenue

My brother is kind of ridiculous. He is sick and was pissed at me so he fake sneezed on me. I swear he's a little bastard. He doesn't seem to understand how annoying he is and how rude he is. It's almost like he doesn't have a conscience. Ok I can't deal with him so I'm done.

It's funny because I was taking random videos of him basically because I was bored and he flipped out on me. I told him I'd put them on youtube after he sneezed on me and my mom was all "she doesn't know how to put them on youtube." Haha. It's basically just amusing now, really. Like does she honestly think that I wouldn't know how to post a video on youtube? Seriously now. It's like the age of technology and the internet and whatnot. Not to mention I want my possible future career to be something along the lines of a web designer. You honestly, seriously expect someone who is thinking about being a web designer to not know how to post things online? to not have a blog or two? to not have various online accounts for things? Seriously now. The beauty of being more or less computer-savvy is knowing how to make sure they don't find out. As long as I remember.

The Tigers. Oh the Tigers.

Didn't resign Sean Casey, moved Carlos over to first permanently. In my opinion, bad. Got Edgar Renteria for shortstop. We'll see about that.
I guess overall the Cabrera/Willis trade is good... if only for the Right Now of the team. I am concerned about the future... I mean all those prospects they traded to get Cabrera/Willis? We'll see how it works out I guess. 
But with the addition of Cabrera comes the likely departure of Brandon Inge. Oh Brandon. I know you tend to suck it up with the bat, but I will always love you. Longest tenured Tiger. Possibly (I don't know for sure off the top of my head) the last/one of the last Tigers of '03 left. Good thing? Bad thing? I guess that will depend on your take on things. I guess it's kind of like... leave '03 in the past. But then there's also the whole players who have gone through that will appreciate winning that much more thing. 

Oh Tigers. How you occupy me with a constant mental struggle.



I am fully aware I am a loser. I have gotten over it, so should you.

ummmm. ... WTF are these rumors about a possible Cabrera/Willis deal? Where the Tigers apparently would be willing to trade Andrew Miller or Cameron Maybin. WTF IS THIS?? Friggin' effing crazy talk. I swear to god...

I think I'm gonna fucking punch somebody. My family is the most ridiculous thing I've ever seen. I really want to do something... part of me wants to talk about, just rant and whatnot but then the other, I think bigger, part of me just wants to ignore it. Just fuck it all. I'm really sick of ranting and venting and yelling and thinking about it. No matter what I say, nothing is going to change or get better. Not at all. It's probably one of the most frustrating things I've ever dealt with. My dad is the biggest asshole I know and both of my parents are so in love with their mircle child that they can't see/won't see what he really is. I don't like or agree with the way my family is and does things, which wouldn't really be that big of a big a deal if I wasn't ridiculed for thinking or acting differently. Like do they even look at how they are? My mom is crying right now because I'm "ignoring her" because I haven't vaccumed my room yet. I don't even know how to handle this anymore. Everything I say doesn't matter. It doesn't matter how loud I yell or how hard I fight because they can't hear me or what I say. They won't open up their eyes. It's a helpless feeling. And I"m done.

The Tigers traded Omar Infante to the Cubs today =(

I absolutely loved Omar, from day one. He was my first favorite player and I have always rooted for him. Hell, I remember him from the Mud Hens, that's how far he and I go back. 
In short, I am really upset about losing Omar. He's been a Tiger since 2002 and has been in the organization his entire career, I think. 
But, putting this in perspective, I guess this move will probably end up being the best thing for him. He wasn't getting the playing time he deserved here in Detroit, partially because it seemed as though Leyland didn't like him, which is thus far Jim's only visible flaw. That and the whole chain-smoking thing. In retrospect, somewhere in the back of my mind, I kind of had an idea Omar wouldn't be around much longer. I think we all did. Especially after that trip to the minors last season. But I have always believed that he could be an everyday middle infielder and I really really hope he gets the chance now in Chicago. I wish him the best of luck in the NL, and I will continue to follow him and continue to root for him. I won't forget you, Omar, I love you.
Basically, I am now also a Cubs fan, ha.

Also, I am not sure I like the direction the Tigers are now going. The guy they got in return for Omar is probably meant to be a platoon with Marcus in left, which I don't like. Personally I believe that Marcus completely has the ability to be an everyday leftfielder, if he would just be given the chance. Also I am still irked about the decision to not resign Sean Casey. He's a .300 lefty. You couldn't ask for anyone better in the clubhouse. I like Carlos at short, that's his home, it's where his heart is. He's a team player though. I don't know about the Renteria thing. I just don't know what to think about that. I don't know much about him except he did not do well in his only stint in the AL, which is slightly concerning. I guess we'll see. But for now, I'm not very happy. Especially with the whole another Zumaya freak accident injury. I am pretty okay with Todd Jones coming back, especially after the Zoom thing. Now we must resign Kenny.

Good luck, Omar.
Go Cubs.

"There's an old proverb that says you can't choose your family. You take what the fates hand you. And like them or not, love them or not, understand them or not, you cope. Then there's the school of thought that says the family you're born into is simply a starting point. They feed you, and clothe you, and take care of you until you're ready to go out into the world and find your tribe."

--Grey's Anatomy, season 2 "Grandma Got Run Over by a Reindeer"

We are reading excerpts from John Smith in AP Language. I don't understand what any of them are saying. Now we have to write some kind of paper/short response about one. This is the most clueless paper I have ever written. Ever. Period. And it's only half a page long.

Placido Polanco won the AL second baseman GOLD GLOVE!
Hell yeah.
Completely deserved, well done. Not that there was any doubt that he would get it, having an errorless season and all.

Pudge also won the Gold Glove at catcher, but I'm way more excited about Polly's. 

Polanco is my hero. 
=)

Semi-side note... I do think that Curtis Granderson should have won the Gold Glove for center.

my heartbeat racing the interstate

we can't hide an echo

I kind of have this feeling that I want to talk about some things, but at the same time, I really don't want to talk about them. I don't want to spend time thinking and bringing to the surface what I want to talk about. Even if it's just thinking about it to myself. Healthy, I know, but for now I guess I'll just stick to the burying them inside me thing.

With each passing day I get more and more sick of my family and my house. I'm sick of having that "minor" label, like because I'm not 18 I can't make decisions for myself. I feel suffocated by my parents and my mom's constant need to know where I am and what I'm doing every moment. I understand that she's my mom, and is therefore worried and has a right to know, etc. But still. I'm almost 17. I'm trying to prepare myself for my own life. I think they are kind of unaware of the fact that one day I am going to be on my own and they won't be able to keep me here, under their attempt at a shield from the world. 

I've been thinking a lot lately about "family" and what it means. This is one of those things that I want to talk about that I mentioned earlier, but I can't quite bring myself to record it, write it down. I have, however, fully thought most of it through, which I guess is a step. You know how sometimes you don't finish your own thoughts because you know what you're thinking? You know what you're thinking and you know what you're feeling, so you don't need to finish the thought or to put it all into words. You just kind of... let the feeling float there in your head without pulling it up. You can see it, you know it's there, but you don't pull it out of the water for fear you have to face it. 

Wow analogy. Been doing a lot of those lately in chemistry, ha. 




"I'm not gonna write you a love song..."

disregard the footsteps and we'll never tell a soul...

tonight I'm finding a way to make the things that you say
just a little less obvious

The Tigers season is over. It's over and it kills me. This season ended up so bitter-sweet there aren't even words to describe it really. Polanco got 200 hits and his errorless record is still ongoing. Magglio is the batting champion. Carlos surpassed 100 RBIs. Justin threw a no-hitter. Curtis joined the exclusive 20-20-20-20 club. Rabelo just hit his first major league homerun. All of that is so utterly awesome it just kills me to have not made the playoffs. Now that I know what it's like to play in October, and after all of those amazing individual accomplishments, it just feels so... not right. Incomplete. You know what I mean. 

And they're not planning on re-signing Sean Casey. I think that kills me maybe just as much. Carlos is going to be the full-time first baseman? Don't like that, either. I know that's not what Carlos would prefer, either, but I think he's a better sport about than me. And if they don't re-sign Pudge? Jesus I don't even know. 

Basically, it's wonderfully painful. So completely wonderfully painful. I guess that's baseball, though, isn't it? 

Congrats, also, to the Phillies. I'm rooting for you guys. 
I would love it if the Indians and Yankees didn't make it past the DS, as well.

I'll write down every word you say
stuff it in a record sleeve
and make sure no one ever ever finds it.

-"Right On, Right Now" by Powerspace


The original was sooooooooooo much better. Good thing I have it downloaded.

edit: The last 3 paragraphs are the most relevant/on my mind/interesting. At least in my mind, as interesting as any of this could be. So the rest of the entry has been deleted. I know, I know. But whatever, get over it. It was pointless ranting/rambling anyway.

When someone asks if my mom wants coffee, she goes "WE don't drink coffee." The "we" referring to all of us. As if she could accurately speak for all of us and our "likes," and as if because we/she doesn't drink coffee, then it MUST be the right thing and the best way to be. My parents tend to be very small minded. Whatever they do, like, or think must be the right way, regardless. There doesn't even seem to be the consideration that there may be other, perfectly fine ways or ideas or things outside of their own.  

My dad especially claims to be all knowledgable and experienced in life. But seriously, the dude has not ever lived outside of this general town. As it is now, he lives about a five minute drive from where he grew up. There is nothing wrong with that really. I mean, I love my grandparents and they are awesome people. 

But come on. They really have NO IDEA what it's like to live outside of the county. Maybe it's just me being all fucking "inexperienced" and stuff, but  I want to know what else there is. I'm not going to sit in this town for the rest of my life. My mom says they like it here. And I'm sure they do. It's not a bad place to live, I guess. But none of us really have anything to compare it to. So how can you be so sure?

I've been waiting
and I'm debating 
whether I'm
getting through to you...

Well hello, Livejournal. Been a couple weeks, eh? 
 
I have been fairly busy since coming back from vacation... I went back to work the day after we got back. It's actually pretty enjoyable now and I kind of feel like I'm actually beginning to make a difference... I think there's been an increase in website orders. Which is cool.
Vacation was pretty good, considering. I mean, a hell of a lot of family and my brother was always annoying. Either because he was bored or he was being an ass or because he was all "look at this" and "watch this," but eh. 
I have to say that I liked driving through/past the cities (Chicago, Denver, St. Louis) more than the actual "destination" of the Rocky Mountains. Don't get me wrong, the mountains were amazing. (Pictures on Flickr soon, hopefully, but this is my first real day all alone since coming home.) But dude the cities were amazing... looking, anyway. We didn't stop, just drove through. Except we stopped in St. Louis to see the Arch. There were SO MANY people wearing Cardinals gear around there... I've never seen so many people all wearing team gear except in and around a stadium. Which, I guess you can see the Busch Stadium from the Arch, but still. It was cool to see, minus them being, you know, World Champions and whatnot. 
I tried to get as many good pictures out the tinted, smeared window of our minivan as a could driving past the cities. I am in love with metros and bus stops, seriously. I want to go to college in Chicago. I want to experience city life. I'd ride the metros. I could totally see myself reading and stuff on them/while waiting for them. Don't ask, that's another story for another time. As it is I'm trying to make up for the past two weeks in one entry. 
But anyway, as cool as the Rockies were, the cities were cooler, even though we didn't even get into them, just through them on the highway. Oh, highway. 
Next summer I am going to the Bronx. I am going to see Yankee Stadium before it closes. I have to.

So, I am alone today. My brother started his first day of Jr. High today, ha. I start school tomorrow and I have to say that I am looking forward to it more so than I thought I would be come the day before school. I talked to my counselor and I managed to get back into Interactive Media, which I'm really happy about. So I dropped economics/contemporary law and AP Psych, which I can then take next year for the 1/2 credit of social studies needed to graduate. So the addition of IM helps. I got a parking spot, too, so that is good there. Except I don't have a car yet, so I'm borrowing my mom's and she's borrowing my grandparents'. 
Seriously I don't know what I'd do without them. They've helped us all out so many times. They're even going to help pay for whatever third car we eventually get. They are completely awesome people. And they won't take money from us, ever. So I am going to hopefully go over and help them (mostly my grandma) with her computer/cell phone/new digital camera sometimes, trying (though I don't know if I'll ever be able to) pay them back, in a sense. 

Alright, I need to go do my Chem summer homework. I finished the third and final book we had to read last night. I could totally ramble on about more, like how much I like reading books like that, but I do not like Chemistry. Hence why I have not done it yet. 

Oh, and The Format is freakin' amazing. Totally and completely. Especially their "Interventions and Lullabies" CD. Sooooo amazing. From the lyrics to the... everything. Amazing.

"...no one I know is more depressing than me..."
"...we're singing it, I'll tap the brake while you crack the window, the smell of smoke is making my lungs explode, the 51 is backed up and too slow, let's tune out by turing on the radio..."
"Haven't we heard this song about a thousand times before? Oh well, after a while it all sounds the same I guess it's better than silence and better than shame..."
"I'm nicotine, I'm coming clean, I fooled the crowd when I made it sound like I was more than ready"
"...strike up the band, deprive my sleep cause there's no love like apathy..."
"I'm trying to find truth in words, in notes, in all the things I wish I'd wrote..."
"I'm nicotine, I'm a cash machine, I'm the color green and you should've seen the looks I just received."
"I need a reason to let go, an intervention a lullaby..."
"...while I'm here losing sleep, your sore thumb, your best defense, is miles from home oh and it reads like a letter with the words all broken, erase them with a razor blade cause you're gone..."
"We just gotta take our time. It's like nothing really matters so let's make this moment a crime..."

I've been pretty glass is half empty lately. For a few main reasons.
One: School's starting reallyyyyy soon. Too soon. I'm really not at all looking forward to that. I don't at all like my schedule because of the classes and because none of my friends are in them. 
Two: Colleges. It's just depressing to think about, for starters. And then they send you all these letters and emails that are all "see why we're different!" There is no difference. They're either all the same or they're just like all the colleges that are like them. 
Three: We leave for vacation tomorrow. Seriously, I want to go places. There are so many places I want to go. I just really don't want to go there with my family. Honestly it's probably going to be hell. Spending every hour of the day with them for the next ten days? Holy fuck. It's gonna be awful.
Four: Band camp. I'm not in band. I don't go to band camp. But for the next month or whatever it's going to be all I hear about. Literally practically all of my friends are in band and I hate marching band season because of it. First semester always sucks more than any other. I think mostly for that reason.
I'm done, enough pathetics. See you in ten days?

I'm beginning to pack for vacation and I found a vacation list on the computer from... I don't even know how long ago. But a while ago. There's stuff on it like "rubber bands for teeth" (aka those annoying, painful things they make you wear with your braces). I got my braces off... maybe 3-4 years ago I think. And there's "flip flops" on there. I have no idea when the last time I wore those kinds of flip flops was. The thong kind? Uh, no thanks. I've got my Adidas ones, and those are all I need. It's weird, though. I'm so different. I never really was comfortable in the "cute" clothes thing. I think jean shorts are one of the most uncomfortable things to wear. Ditto with real bras. I wear a sports bra everyday I can. But it didn't used to be like that. I call it my 'awkward stage' ha. I used to wear the stuff everybody else wears, you know, what's in style and whatnot. But not anymore. Now I wear what's comfortable to me. 
And braces? Haha. Oh god those were the days.

I'm gonna go back to a subject I talked about a while ago here. That stupid 'praying' that my family does before we eat. It pisses me off. It pisses me off not because we do it, but how we do it. My brother slurs through the whole thing so fast you can hardly tell what he's saying. And then he ends it with a "Let us chow!" that is pretty much the only thing somebody who didn't know the prayer would actually understand. And they obsess about holding hands during the thing. So much so that they actually miss most of if not all of the actual prayer trying to hold my hand or at least touch me in some way. It's so ridiculous. 

More later, hopefully. I have to go to my brother's game and this fucking computer wasn't working for the last ten minutes. Damnit.

edit: I previously edited/updated, but stupid livejournal had an error and didn't save it. So I am going to try to rethink most of it. 

My brother's game was cancelled today because it rained earlier in the day. We went all the way out there to find out it was cancelled. I was actually kind of disappointed because I had finally brought my camera. I want to take pictures of the fields because they really are amazing. Especially at night. And especially when they're empty. (Seriously, that is where I want to lose it someday. In the outfield grass. No joke. Hahaha. I'm a nerd, I know.) But his game is rescheduled for tomorrow, which is kind of inconvenient because I was planning on going over to a friend's house. Which I think I am still going to do. Even though this is potentially their last game, if they lose. Oh decisions, decisions.

Anyway, back to my original topic. The prayer is a fucking joke. It really is. There is no meaning behind when they do it that way. I'm not an extremely religious person, but I have my things. I mean, I'm nothing like how my mom wants me to be in that area. She has made that quite clear to me. Especially with all of her recent "I should have sent you to a Catholic school" woe-ing. Because I cuss too much. Which I probably do around her.

But I am more religious than she realizes. I just don't like her kind of religion. So, yeah, in that sense, she failed her duty as a Catholic mother. She did not raise a devoted Catholic daughter. Her son, however, is seemingly coming along just fine. Oh yes, he carries the hypocritical trait of Catholics so very well. When I say "goddamn" and say I don't want to go to church he gets all "you're defying God" in front of her. But seriously. He's so two-faced and selfish I don't see how he could be considered a good Christian in any eyes but a Catholic's. At least most Catholics I know. AND he thought the pope was Jewish. Not even kidding.

But I honestly think that you don't have to be all "I live my life solely for God and everything I do is for him" to be a good Christian.

My mom really only goes to church when it's convenient. Like when we don't have any games and when she doesn't work the weekend. I honestly think that if you're going to play the devoted card, you need to make an effort to go to church every weekend, regardless of what is going on. I mean, it's one hour for something you believe in. Now, I don't personally like church. (At least not the ones I've been to. There is probably one out there that I would like, but being only 16 I haven't exactly been given an opportunity to look for/find it.) But it would be so much easier and acceptable in my mind to respect my mom's desire for me to go to church with her if she wasn't so hypocritical about everything surrounding religion.

I am mostly content with my... uh... spirituality? I guess I'm not really comfortable calling it a religion because I don't want to feel like I have to conform to any one set of beliefs. But I believe in God. And I'm not a bad person for the most part. I think that is the most important part. Maybe my thing isn't to have a religion, but my own "beliefs" that happen to include things about God and parts of religion. Like I don't believe in drugs. I don't believe that homosexuals are wrong. I'm not really sure on the premarital sex thing yet. (That is a biggie for my mom. She continuously says "And I KNOW you know that that is WRONG" whenever un-married people on TV are having sex. Well, truthfully, I don't think it's WRONG. They can do whatever they want, reasonably speaking. I don't even think it's wrong for me personally. I think it's more of a matter of being "ready" or not. I'm pretty sure there isn't going to be a clear cut yes or no.

Wow. I have rambled and gotten off track a TON. I will end it now, and leave you with this:

Urban Dictionary's word of the day
Sapiosexual: One who finds intelligence the most sexually attractive feature.

My god work is exhausting. I worked from about 8 til about 4 four days this week. I'm so tired. It's not even that fun. I thought working on a website would be fun, but I was being ingnorant. Yeah, ok, it's fun and really easy at times and I love internet and tech stuff. But it's frustrating a LOT. I mean, they hired me to work on their website but they don't give me a computer to work on. So I spend a fourth of my time looking for a place to work. There are also not very many resources. It just gets frustrating sometimes. But it pays more than minimum and it's way more flexible than just about any other job would, which is something I need. Oh contradictions, how you mess with me.
But I can only work 20 hours next week, so it'll be better I think.

Anyway, onwards. 

The other day I was online looking at Curtis Granderson's (Tigers centerfielder) ESPN blog and my brother was sitting on the chair in the computer room behind me (like he is right now). He looked up and flipped out on me because he saw the word "blog" on the screen. I was like dude, chill. It's not mine it's CURTIS GRANDERSON'S. For god's sake. But he wouldn't let it go. He was like, "well, still. You shouldn't be looking at a blog." Okay, mom. Seriously. 1) He needs to leave me alone and mind his own business; 2) Even my parents let me look at players' etc. blogs. Not that them not letting me would stop me. But still.

I love cookies and cream ice cream, it's amazing.

I haven't done much online music listening/exploring lately, due to my imense workage. I miss it. But that's what I'm doing right now, it's awesome.

Alright, I'm going to go now.

We went to the Tigers game today. It really doesn't matter how many times I go, the field is always breathtaking. Call it cheesy, call it obsessive, call it whatever you want, but seriously. 
I took a lot of pictures, as you can imagine, but I don't think any of them really came out with the clarity and breathtaking-factor that there is in real life. My little digital camera isn't the greatest of quality for that kind of thing, so it made it that much harder to capture what it felt like.
I will eventually post them up on my flickr account, which I got up and running (sort of) last month. For some reason, I can't get my pictures into sets on my computer. It just never loads. I left it up for hours once and nothing happened. Oh well, nobody looks at it, so it doesn't really matter right now I guess. But I will get these pictures up soon, hopefully. Next time I'm home alone. Which, in reality, probably won't be anytime soon because of my stupid job.

But about the game: I know I said that I love pitching duels, and I do. I love them. But when playing your rivals (the Indians), it is a great thing to see them get ripped. Oh yes, today the Tigers pummeled the Indians. And won the series. Big win. Huge win. Great fun. 

I'm going to a college recruiting camp thing tomorrow. I'm kind of nervous because there are supposed to be a ton of college scouts there to watch and whatnot. I'm not even really sure if I want to play softball in college right now, but this is a big step, I think. I guess I've got nothing to lose, though, right? Nothing to lose.

(Pretty much unrelated to tomorrow's camp): I need to have a clear head. That's what I need to succeed at softball. I've figured it out. A clear, calm head. Which includes not thinking much. Not thinking.

I'm kind of in one of those moods where I don't want to be around people. I just want to be alone right now. I know I only worked two full days all week, but I'm exhausted, so that might have something to do with it. I just got a new CD, Interventions & Lullabies by The Format today, and I want to just chill and listen to it, but my grandparents are over for the Fourth. 
I'm pretty sure I'm going to have to get off really soon here though because they're beginning to get back into the house. And I'm not allowed to have anything at all close to a blog and I love them, so I can't risk it.

It's been a while since I've updated, so here goes.

Placido Polanco is now leading all AL second basemen in the all star voting. Good job, this is well deserved. Keep up the voting. While I'm on the Tigers subject... I don't understand why Andrew Miller is in the rotation over Chad Durbin. Yes, Miller pitched six shutout innings yesterday, but he threw almost entirely fastballs. And against the offensively-challenged Braves. Come on now. The dude's obviously gotta work on his offspeed stuff, and I don't think that he can properly do that up here. And Chad Durbin pitched AMAZINGLY during his time in the rotation, especially considering he wasn't even supposed to be, you know, good. Chad Durbin can throw pitches other than his fastball for strikes, thus leading me to believe that he will be more effective than Miller at this point. Ah well. That's why I'm not the manager, I 'spose.

My first stitches, not including the ones in my mouth after oral surgery a few years ago. I'm actually surprised it took this long, ha. I hit an RBI double that game, too. Take that.
Two weekends ago we went 7-1 in a tournament, which is crazy good. I didn't have a tournament this past weekend, so things are even more noneventful than normal.
We got new phones, finally. Our old ones were crap, so I'm pretty happy about this.
I really want a ton of CDs, but I don't want to spend any of my money because I reallyyyyyy want a car before school starts again. 
I hate school. I kind of dislike life, too. It's so damn noneventful it's killing me. Whatever, I guess. I'll get over it, I always do. 

Okay, I'm done.

Vote for Placido Polanco.

Detroit Tigers second baseman Placido Polanco needs your help. Right now, he is second in the American League All Star voting to Yankees second baseman Robinson Cano. 

Polanco is so much more deserving of an All Star start than Cano. Really, there is no comparision. 

Quo Vadimus wrote an excellent piece on exactly why Polanco should be this year's starter, but here are the quick numbers splits:

Robinson Cano: Batting Average: .275
Placido Polanco: Batting Average: .345

Robinson Cano: RBI: 29
Placido Polanco: RBI: 32

Robinson Cano: On Base Percentage: .314
Placido Polanco: On Base Percentage: .389

Robinson Cano: Batting Average with runners in scoring position: .194
Placido Polanco: Batting Average with runners in scoring position: .429

Robinson Cano: 6 errors
Placido Polanco: 0 errors

There really is no comparison. Polanco has been so much better.

So, if by the off chance that someone happens to read this, GO VOTE POLANCO for the American League All Star second baseman.

On Fox News this afternoon there was a story about the cracked up lady who drove her station wagon into a crowd of people at a festival in D.C. If I heard it correctly, she had been arrested 23 times before this. TWENTY-THREE TIMES!!! Who lets somebody like that back into society?? Honestly.  I think they said she'd pleaded guilty 3 times to crack possession or something having to do with crack. Who lets somebody like that back into society? Shouldn't there be someone, if they DON'T lock them up, watching people like that closely? Like parole officers or something? What is going through your minds when you think to yourself, ah welllll it's ok, we can let her 23 ARRESTS go unnoticed, go ahead, go free... to go DRIVE nonetheless?? 

I don't have facts or anything, but it seems to me that this isn't right. Yes, arrests don't always mean that they actually committed the crime they were arrested for. But, um, out of 23 I think there's a pretty good chance that some of them were deserving. And SOME out of TWENTY-THREE is still a crap load. Too many, in my opinion, to be allowed to be released back into society.

Once again, I don't have all the facts or information and I am basing this on what I've heard on news exerts on TV and the blurbs online I've been able to find. So don't get offensive or all OMG!! on me.

I love words. They're amazing. I love the way you can use them to do so many different things. You can make the same words mean completely different things. You can make words mean something they aren't meant to mean. You can arrange them differently and you can interpret them differently. Everybody could get something different out of the same phrase. I love how there are so many different words that mean the same general things. But then at the same time they can mean something entirely different. Synonyms for words can describe things differently than others. Words can describe things in the coolest ways. They can be beautiful, they can be ugly, they can be contemplative, they can be shallow, they can be evasive. Words can make you feel things. They can make others feel things. They can be just about anything you want to make them. But then sometimes, you just can't seem to make them say what you want. You may have the general meaning, but not the feel that you're looking for. It's that feeling, that personal feeling, that makes words so awesome. 
Everybody has a different style of putting these words together, too. The words they choose and how they choose to arrange them very often represents who they are as a person. How the words are interpreted by individuals makes that person who they are. 
And to ever not be able to have that variation of words that allows one to so carefully express the feeling they want is a horrible thought. It's a violation of freedom of speech. In my opinion, freedom of speech is not just the ability to speak your mind, but also to express it how you want. It's one thing to have an opinion or a thought, but to be able to really, truly express how you feel is something that Newspeak does not allow. To minimize the words you can use for expression is just a complete violation of freedom of speech. I don't think that feeling something is completely the same as having an opinion.
I love words.
